Hello everyone :slightly_smiling_face:

hiya <@U1XQ25E4R>
is there a way to prevent a component from rendering?

attachments.title: emberjs/ember.js

text: <@U047GTU64>: wrap in {{if}}?
yeah I decided to go for that
but I wanted tha tlogic inside the component
that way the person using it doesn’t need to worry about it
but then again I could just wrap the whole template inside an if
but that would still instantiate the component :eyes:
there’s a private `this.destroyElement()`
<@U047GTU64>: Wait, so you wanted someone to use a component that _sometimes_ doesn't render?

Need a steer on ED. have a model with an async belongsto relationship that's lazy loaded using links. Need to refresh the link periodically. Model.reload() doesn't touch the lazy relationship. How do you make ED reload a link?
<@U03V2PZUB>: yeah?
<@U047GTU64>: and hiding via css won't suffice?
I’m trying to prevent having some JS running that shouldnt :smile:
im not bothered by just having the if out
<@U047GTU64>: I guess my thinking is that if you use a component you would assume it would render. Perhaps create an "internal" component which is wrapped inside another "user facing" one?
<@U047GTU64>: Just thinking out loud... you would have to document the rendering logic somewhere so you may as well just create a component which does that instead.

<@U047GTU64>: I’ve used tagless components for this in the past. `tagName: ‘’` in the component.js and then an `{{#if …}}` around everything in the template. Then nothing is rendered in the DOM if it’s not shown
if the JS is kicked off with computed properties, then when the content isn’t rendered the JS won’t run.
<@U044QMK6K>: had that in mind too :smile:
more and more of my components are tagless these days, looking forward to angle-bracket components etc where that will be much nicer
